titlePart.supplied: Address to the New Jersey Birth Control League

sourceDesc.bibl: Mrs. Sanger Speaks Here, Newark Star Eagle, Nov. 01, 1932

headNote.p: Sanger spoke to the New Jersey Birth Control League in Newark. Others appearing included Henrietta Hart and Hannah Mayer Stone. No draft version of these remarks were found, the text here comes from press coverage.

docBody.head: Sanger Speaks Here
Urges N.J Clinic to Aid Happiness of Families.

p.q: Mrs. Margaret Sanger, leading birth control advocate, urged her hearers to demand political candidates to reveal their views on birth control when she addressed 200 members of the New Jersey Birth Control League yesterday at a housewarming exercises at the new quarters of the Maternal Health Center, 42 Park place.

div.p: “I want you also to ask the heads of your institutions for the incompetent what they are doing to help cut down the need for the appalling bill for the maintenance of these institutions,” Mrs. Sanger pleaded.

div.head: EARLY MARRIAGE

p.q: Although she said she believes in early marriage, especially in hard times, because a young couple can live together more cheaply than apart, Mrs. Sanger opposes the early assumption of the responsibility of children.

div.p: “There would be fewer divorces among young people,” she said, “If they could have at least two years to get really acquainted with each other and to have fun together before the children came.”

p.q: Mrs. Sanger revealed that she had been named consultant to the Mexican government in birth control work and has been working in Washington for the passage of a bill in Congress permitting dissemination of birth control information by medical authorities.
